title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire - BBC News
summary: no gas supply in oundle until weekend .
a6 closed between the a14 and desborough until monday .
saints face montpelier in france tonight .
corby gymnast daniel keatings retires from the sport .

documents.title: montpellier 26-17 northampton
text: montpellier 26-17 northampton
author: Alex Bysouth
BBC Sport

documents.title: that 's all from us
text: live updates have now finished for northamptonshire .
if you want to follow northampton town against mk dons tomorrow head to the bbc sport website .
there 's also coverage of northampton saints ' trip to montpellier on bbc radio northampton .
we 'll see you on monday .
have a great weekend .

documents.title: overnight weather : dry with a widespread frost
text: it 'll be a dry night across the bbc east region with mainly clear skies , a widespread frost and some patchy mist and freezing fog .
there 'll be light winds and temperatures in some spots could fall as low as -5c ( 23f ) .
some mist and fog may be slow to clear saturday morning .
overall it 'll be a dry day , but thicker cloud is likely to feed in from the north sea , perhaps producing some patchy rain in north norfolk .
the best of any sunshine and brightness will be in the south of the region with highs around 6c ( 43f ) .
get a full forecast where you live from bbc weather .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: northampton town face mk dons tomorrow
text: tomorrow northampton town will be making the short trip down the m1 ( or a5 ) to mk dons , with new striker keshi anderson in the squad for the match .
northampton town sit 16th in league , with the dons two points and three places below them .
it 's also just over a year since the cobblers faced mk dons at stadium mk in an fa cup third round reply , taking more than 7,000 fans to the game .
that day mk dons won 3-0 , but justin edinburgh will be hoping for better in his first game in charge of the cobblers .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: council to spend more on care
text: northamptonshire county council says it is going to invest more in adult social care .
a care home boss told the bbc she would n't consider opening a new home in the county because local authority pay rates are too low .
in a statement the council said : `` we work very closely with care home providers and are fully aware of the issues facing the market today . ''

the authority says it has increased the fees it pays providers for the last three years running and is proposing to put an extra £ 1.8m towards the cost of residential and nursing care in the next financial year .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: care boss 'would n't open ' home in northamptonshire
text: the owner of a care home chain says she would n't consider opening a new home in northamptonshire because of the low rates paid by the county council .
blanchworth care runs nine homes but is in the process of closing its only northamptonshire home , culworth house .

owner sally roberts says the main reason for the closure is the state of the building , but says running the home has been `` extremely difficult '' financially because of the low rates paid for places by northamptonshire county council .
she said `` fee levels are not sufficient to meet the true cost of care '' and are lower in northamptonshire than in oxfordshire and gloucestershire , where her other homes are based .
ms roberts said it had two residents who were assessed to receive the same level of support , one in oxfordshire and one in northamptonshire .
the oxfordshire resident was `` paid £ 42 more per week than the resident in northamptonshire '' , she said .
the county council says it 's aware of the issues and is looking to invest extra money .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: fire at northampton town centre pub
text: the emergency services have been dealing with a fire at the fox and quill pub on st giles terrace in northampton .
several fire engines and an ambulance are at the scene and the area around the premises has been cordoned off .
the building was evacuated just after 13:00 after a fire broke out in the kitchen .
no-one has been injured , but a firefighter has been taken to hospital as a precaution .
st giles terrace , dychurch lane and fish street are all closed to vehicles and pedestrians .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: harborough woman fears conflict in gambia
text: west african leaders are in gambia to try to persuade yahya jammeh to cede power to his elected successor .
sharon jervis from market harborough helps to run a school in gambia and is the founder of the gambian children 's fund .
she said : `` all the businesses have closed , all the lines of communication are shutting down .
i pray there wo n't be conflict , but i think there probably will be .
he does n't want to step down and he 's going to fight to hold his seat . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : bright and sunny , though rather cold
text: any lingering mist and fog will clear to leave a bright and sunny day with clear blue skies .
it will be feeling cold though with a high of just 5c ( 41f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: london midland says it has 'no intention of removing conductors ' from trains
text: london midland said the proposed changes were in reaction to feedback from staff and passengers .
a spokesman for the train operator said : `` the security contractors are in addition to the senior conductors and have different duties .
`` this is about safety as we have told the rmt many times .
we have no intention of removing conductors from our trains . ''
the rmt said it had been `` left with no option but to ballot '' after london midland management failed to respond to its questions and proposals .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: london midland conductors threaten strike action
text: train conductors on london midland have announced they will take a vote over strike action .
rail union rmt said it was balloting its 523 members over the proposed imposition of security contractors on trains .
the union says the company 's move was made without agreement .
the ballot closes on 2 february .

rmt general secretary mick cash said : `` the imposition of external contractors who have no additional skills or powers of authority to remove unruly passengers or fare dodgers is something we are totally opposed to . ''
london midland said it was `` very disappointed '' the rmt was threatening action .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: watch : keatings wins european gymnastics pommel horse gold
text: as corby gymnast daniel keatings announces his retirement , relive the moment in 2013 he won european gold on the pommel horse
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: corby 's gold medal gymnast daniel keatings retires
text: great britain gymnast daniel keatings has announced his retirement from the sport .
the 27-year-old from corby , a two-time european pommel horse champion and 2014 commonwealth gold medallist for scotland , made the announcement on twitter .
keatings , who also won world all-around silver in 2009 and got married last year , said : `` after much consideration , i have decided to call time on my gymnastics career .
`` i feel really lucky to have represented great britain and scotland at the highest level and i take away with me so many great memories that will stay with me for the rest of my life . ''
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: teenage gang arrested after series of northampton robberies and stabbings
text: three 14-year-old boys have been arrested after a series of robberies on wednesday evening in northampton , which left three people with stab wounds .
the five robberies happened between 17:00 and 19:00 in the lumbertubs and thorplands area of the town .
the arrests were made yesterday after reports of a similar incident in billing brook road , when a man in his 40s was threatened with a knife .
the three boys remain in police custody .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: northamptonshire sporting venues looking glorious in the sunshine too
text: it 's not just oundle that 's looking pretty
it may be a while until the british grand prix and the cricket season is under way , but silverstone and wantage road look almost ready for action in today 's sunshine

documents.title: upside of no gas number two - it 's beautiful outside
text: obviously you would rather have gas than not - and it is pretty cold today - but if you can wrap up warm then northamptonshire is looking beautiful .
and as you can see , oundle is rather lovely

documents.title: upside of no gas number one - hats in the library
text: there is still no gas in oundle , but it seems many places are still carrying on as usual .
oundle school is open as normal - except the students heading into the library have been allowed a few extra layers to cope with the lack of heat
uniform regs are relaxed .
with no heating across town for next few days , it 's cold in there !
keep warm with some inclusive sport ha , ha # p2iuk bringing inclusive activities to schools across uk

documents.title: hartley , lawes , harrison and wood all in england six nations squad
text: four northampton saints players have been named in england 's squad for the six nations tournament , which starts next month .
dylan hartley is included despite currently serving a six-week ban for striking an opponent , which ends next week .
also named are courtney lawes , teimana harrison and the saints ' captain tom wood .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: how cold is it for you ?
text: after a bitterly cold night , and a frosty morning , the idea of a duvet day was very tempting .
how cold was it for you ? .
bbc east weatherman dan holley 's tweet may have the answer .
e anglia min temps : -6.1c woburn -5.7c writtle -5.6c s downham -4.2c cambridge -3.9c houghton hall -3.7c monks wd -3.6c brooms barn + marham

documents.title: uk looks for hs2 train builder
text: the search for a company to take on the £ 2.75bn contract to build high speed trains for the hs2 rail network got under way on friday .
the department for transport said up to 60 trains , capable of speeds of 225mph ( 362km/h ) , were needed .
the contract , which will also involve maintaining the fleet , will be awarded in 2019 .
the trains are for the first phase of the project , due to run between london and birmingham cutting through buckinghamshire and northamptonshire .
it is expected to reduce rail times between birmingham and london by 32 minutes .
construction will begin later this year and it will open in 2026 .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: dj designs music module
text: turntablism has actually been added to the music curriculum at robert smyth academy in market harborough .
the module was designed in part by award winning dj mr switch
i did once try this and it was incredibly hard .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : dj lessons added to the curriculum
text: music lessons have come a long way since i was at school - these students in market harborough are getting turntablism lessons
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: eddie jones set to name england six nations squad
text: this morning england head coach eddie jones will name his squad for the upcoming six nations .
expected to be included , and named as captain , is northampton saints ' dylan hartley , despite the 30-year-old currently serving a six-week ban for striking .
alongside hartley , northampton saints ' captain tom wood and his fellow back-row forward teimana harrison are expected to be in the squad , having been praised by jones earlier this week .
england start their six nations campaign - where they are defending champions - on 4 february at twickenham .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: closure of the a6 due to 'crumbling road foundations '
text: the a6 between rothwell and desbough is unlikely to re-open until monday morning at the earliest .
engineers are examining a problem beneath the road surface .
rebecca miller , from northamptonshire highways , said on the approaches to the bridge over the river ise the `` foundations are crumbling underneath '' the road surface .
she said it is not a hole `` but could become one '' , and engineers need to work out what is happening , why , and how the problem can be fixed .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: gas still off in oundle , but two thirds of homes visited by engineers
text: about 2,500 homes in oundle are still without gas supplies this morning .
national grid says it fixed the fault that caused the problem yesterday , but can not return supplies until engineers have turned off everyone 's gas .
they visited two thirds of homes in oundle yesterday and started visiting the rest of the properties this morning .
national grid also said people who were considered `` vulnerable '' were visited by 23:00 last night and `` further assistance '' was given to them .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : a chilly day , but with plenty of sunshine
text: there will be some mist and fog patches around this morning , but these will clear to leave a dry and bright day with plenty of blue sky and sunshine .
despite this , it will feel rather chilly outside with a high of 6c ( 43f ) .
here 's my full forecast
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back
text: good morning .
you may get a sense of deja vu this morning , as i can tell you oundle has no gas and the a6 is closed between the a14 and desborough .

we 'll bring you the latest soon , but away from that we 'll be looking at the state of care homes in the county and building up to the saints trip to france , and the much shorter trip for the cobblers to mk dons .
but first up , the full ( and chilly ) weather forecast .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: community order for venetian blind thief
text: community order for venetian blind thief

documents.title: that 's all from us
text: live updates for northamptonshire have now finished .
today we 've found out the gas supply in oundle will be off to many people until at least the weekend .
the a6 between the a14 and desborough will be closed until monday too due to bridge defects .
sigh .
we need cheering up this is the perfect antidote ( thanks kettering weather watcher roval scot ''
we 'll hope for better news tomorrow , where we 'll also be building up to a busy weekend of sport .
see you at 08:00 .

documents.title: cctv of 'flashing blue light ' driver
text: cctv of 'flashing blue light ' driver

documents.title: a cold and frosty night
text: it 's going to be a dry night , with a lot of clear sky .
a sharp frost will develop , with some mist and fog patches , and possibly ice in places .
winds will be light , with temperatures falling as low as -4c ( 25f ) in some isolated places .
in cloudier places , temperatures will stay closer to freezing .
any mist and fog may be slow to clear tomorrow , but it should then become a dry and sunny day .
temperatures expected to reach 6c ( 43f ) .
weather has more details for where you live .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: eight changes for saints ' champions cup game in montpelier tomorrow
text: jim mallinder has rung the changes for the saints ' final european champions cup game against montpelier tomorrow .
however , the side still contains wales wing george north and england forwards paul hill and teimana harrison .
northampton are bottom of their pool and can not qualify for the knock-out stages .
your saints are

even though we 're out of the competition we should still have our best team out

@ twitterid fluffy on the bench ! !
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: mp makes plea for nene park to be saved
text: the mp for corby and east northamptonshire has urged the owners of nene park to take `` one last look to find a solution that retains all or part of this stadium '' .
last week the owners sent notice to the council that they intended to demolish the ground .
but , speaking in the commons , tom pursglove , said it was `` still a fully usable football stadium '' .
mr pursglove said the owners of nene park , conalgen enterprises ltd , should discuss the stadium 's future with the local authority and afc rushden and diamonds .

in response , the leader of the house of commons , david lidington , said the club , the council , and the owner should work together to `` maintain what is clearly a much-loved community sports facility '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: oundle restaurant 'not been able to function ' because of gas outage
text: one person who has been quite badly affected by the gas outage in oundle is adrian elson , of dexters bar and kitchen .
`` the kitchen is all gas , we 're struggling to cook anything .
there 's a very limited menu , no heating and no hot water , we 've not been able to function , '' he told me .
mr elson said he 'll have to email and telephone customers who 've booked tables tonight to apologise , but they are `` trying to do the best we can '' .
author: Stuart Ratcliffe
BBC Look East

documents.title: three people stabbed by teenage gang in northampton
text: police say a teenage gang carried out a series of robberies yesterday evening in northampton and stabbed three people .
the five incidents happened between 17:00 and 19:00 in the lumbertubs and thorplands area of the town .
det insp james larkin said : `` we are treating these incidents extremely seriously .
`` the attacks all happened in a similar area in a short period of time .
all the victims were approached by a group of around five or six teenagers and threatened with violence if they did not hand over their mobile phone . ''
northamptonshire police says there will be patrols in the area through this evening .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: no gas in oundle until the weekend , but source of problem found
text: i 've been in oundle which has been without gas since early this morning .
darren elsom , head of operations at national grid , said the problem was caused by a fault with a piece of equipment that regulates gas pressure .
he told me they have fixed that problem , but because they have to turn off everyone 's gas at the meter before turning it back on , it could take `` a few days '' .
about 50 engineers from all over the country have been working to fix the fault and are now visiting properties in the the town .
it 's a big job - 2,500 homes are affected .
author: Stuart Ratcliffe
BBC Look East

documents.title: a6 around rothwell and desborough closed until monday
text: the a6 is to be closed between the a14 at rothwell and the b576 at the harborough road junction in desborough , until at least monday .
it comes after northamptonshire highways said there were `` failings '' under the road at a bridge over the river ise .
diversions are in place .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: a6 still closed and will be all day
text: the a6 between junction 3 of the a14 and desborough is closed for emergency repairs to a bridge .
northamptonshire highways said the road will be completely closed in both directions for the whole day .
you can find more details on the bbc travel page , and we 'll also update you here .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: what do our councils do ?
text: we 've been discussing the row over how many councils are needed to run services in northamptonshire .
when i was out in kettering town centre talking about this , there was a lot of confusion about what our councils do .
here 's some basics
northamptonshire county council runs adult social care , children 's services , road maintenance and libraries among other things .
our borough and districts run rubbish collections , as well as make most planning decisions .
however , there is plenty of crossover .
here 's just one example - once your rubbish is collected by your local authority , it is disposed of by the county council .
also the county council runs the recycling centres , except ​wollaston , which is run by the borough council of wellingborough .
it 's no wonder people get confused
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: one new council would be a 'huge mistake '
text: the leader of kettering borough council says creating one new authority to run services in northamptonshire would be a `` huge mistake '' .
russell roberts made the comment in a letter to the secretary of state for local government , sajid javid , last month , that i 've seen a copy of .
the county council says millions of pounds would be saved if we replaced the existing eight councils in northamptonshire with one .
but borough and district councils says decisions need to be taken more locally .
speaking to bbc radio northampton today , the leader of wellingborough council said one single authority is `` not the solution to the problems at the county council '' .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: weather : cloudy and mostly dry , but brighter further south
text: it will stay grey and cloudy in the north , with the odd spot of light rain and drizzle possible over higher ground .
in the south and east of the county it 'll be brighter with some sunshine .
highs of 6c ( 43f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: council structure 'ca n't continue '
text: kettering 's mp says he does n't see how the current system of local government in northamptonshire can continue .
northamptonshire county council says £ 29m would be saved if the county 's eight local authorities were replaced by one new one .
but the existing borough and district councils say decisions need to be taken more locally .

as council leaders continue to argue , kettering mp philip hollobone has told bbc radio northampton the status quo can not continue because of `` the delicate state of the county council finances '' .

the conservative mp said the county needs one or two new unitary authorities and said `` to say that we want to stay as we are , we do n't want to change , is n't good enough as far as the government is concerned '' .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: still no gas in oundle , but work under way to fix problem
text: national grid engineers are currently in oundle attempting to find out the cause of the problem that has left the town without gas .
at the moment it 's not known what 's caused the problem or when supplies are being restored .
national grid has set up a facebook page for residents , while the investigation appears to be centred on equipment near waitrose .
schools in oundle are all open and operating normally - indeed one seems quite proud of it
the school is lovely and warm and has heating - unlike other parts of oundle !
@ twitterid no issues here !
maybe set up a space for vulnerable elderly to come and keep warm ?
have spoken to national grid are in the process of arranging that elsewhere in the town we believe .
author: Stuart Ratcliffe
BBC Look East

documents.title: five secondary schools in northamptonshire 'failing '
text: a total of 282 secondary schools in england are deemed to be failing by the government , with five in northamptonshire , having dropped below a new set of national standards .
from this year schools are being judged by new measures , which take greater account of pupil progress than raw results .
the schools are weston favell academy in northampton , kettering science academy , rushden community college , silverstone utc and daventry utc .
it means in total 12.8 % of secondary schools in the county are deemed to be failing , but daventry utc ( is set to close this year after the trustees decided it 's no longer viable .
the department for education says the measures present a clearer of how well schools are performing .
author: BBC News Education

documents.title: lewis hamilton backs new mercedes team-mate valtteri bottas
text: stevenage 's lewis hamilton has backed mercedes replacing nico rosberg with valtteri bottas , says team boss toto wolff .
brackley-based mercedes signed the finn ( right ) this week after agreeing a deal to buy him out of his williams contract to replace rosberg , who retired after winning last year 's world title .
wolff said : `` lewis said he thought valtteri was a nice guy .
`` one of the guys he actually got along with well in formula 1 and he felt he was a good option . ''
wolff said he believed there might be less tension between hamilton and the 27-year-old finn than there was between the triple world champion and rosberg .
`` i think that works well , '' he added .
`` it was ok already between nico and lewis , but there was the luggage of the past now it is a completely new relationship and there is no animosity . ''
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer

documents.title: ex saints-coach king says wales will be 'ambitious '
text: meanwhile , ex-northampton saints ' backs coach alex king has been speaking about his new role as wales ' attack coach for the upcoming six nations .
king , who was sacked by the saints earlier this season , says the team wants to `` play rugby the way the welsh public wants us to play '' .
the 41-year-old 's role is normally held by rob howley , who is in charge of wales while head coach warren gatland is on british and irish lions duty .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: picamoles in french squad for six nations
text: saints number eight louis picamoles has been included in france 's six nations squad .
the 30-year-old , who has more than 50 caps , is the only man selected who plays outside of the french leagues , having moved to northampton in the summer .
france have not won the competition since 2010 , when they also recorded a grand slam .
the tournament begins next month , with england facing france at twickenham on 4 february .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: basking in the costa blanca snow
text: yesterday there were no courgettes for sale on northampton market .
indeed , europe is in the grip of a `` courgette crisis '' .
it 's because of increasingly bad weather across spain and italy .
but how bad can it actually be on the continent ?
well , this is the not so sunny costa blanca from bbc weather watcher 'eyeonthesky ' , who is from desborough
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: a6 closed in both directions between a14 and desborough
text: the a6 between the a14 at junction 3 and the b576 harborough road for desborough is closed for emergency repairs .
a problem with a bridge over the river ise was discovered last night and is currently being investigated .
northamptonshire highways say the road will be closed `` for some time '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: no gas in oundle
text: people in oundle have no gas supply this morning .
national grid engineers are investigating the cause of the problem , but they say they 'll need to visit all properties in the town to turn off the gas safely .
residents are being urged not to try and turn off the supply themselves , and make sure all gas appliances are off .

author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: thursday 's weather : milder in the north , brighter and colder in the south
text: there 's a north/south split in today 's forecast .
it 's cloudy in the north , and also a bit milder , and cold and frosty in the south but this is where we should see the best of the sunshine throughout the course of the day .
towards parts of northampton , bedford and norwich we 're starting above freezing , and there 's plenty of cloud here , perhaps a few spots of drizzle , but generally dry just about everywhere .
towards the south we 've got lots of sunshine around .
top temperatures about 4c to 5c ( 39f-41f ) .
watch my full regional forecast here :
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back
text: good morning .
we are back with live updates for northamptonshire and it might only be 08:00 but we have lots of tell you .
if you are in oundle this morning , you 've got no gas , and if you are hoping to use the a6 you might have trouble .
all that plus the latest sport and weather too .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: driver used flashing blue light 38 times
text: driver used flashing blue light 38 times

documents.title: goodbye from northamptonshire live
text: that 's it from your local live team for today .
any breaking news in the county will still appear here - but if you missed anything have a scroll down the feed .
the main headlines today were :
we 'll be back bright-eyed and bushy-tailed from 08:00 tomorrow .
have a lovely evening - and wrap up warm out there .

documents.title: weather : cold and frosty overnight
text: staying mainly dry across the region , with clear spells in the southeast , but otherwise mostly cloudy .

temperatures will fall widely , perhaps as low as -2c to -5c ( mid 20s f ) , in essex , but 2c to 3c ( mid 30s f ) across northamptonshire and northwestern parts of cambridgeshire - with the potential of mist and fog patches .
tomorrow will stay chilly under rather cloudy skies , with mist and fog slow to clear in northwestern parts of the region .
weather has more local forecasts .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: 'flashing blue light ' driver convicted
text: a northampton man who admitted wrongly driving with a flashing blue light on his vauxhall astra has been found guilty of dangerous driving and eight further driving offences .
northampton magistrates ' court was told 35-year-old martin chapman had been spotted by road cameras using the flashing light on 38 separate occasions .
in one instance chapman was seen narrowly missing a cyclist as he drove through the wrong side of a busy junction on cliftonville road in northampton on 6 july .

the officer who arrested chapman told the court it was a `` dangerous and reckless manoeuvre '' and that chapman told police he had joined the blood service and had intended to use the blue light `` to do urgent blood runs between hospitals '' .
chapman , of connaught street , the mounts , pleaded guilty to five counts of using a vehicle fitted with a `` blue warning beacon '' without permission .
he was found guilty of one count of dangerous driving , three counts of ignoring a red light and road markings and five charges of using a car without correct insurance .
chapman told the court he was `` remorseful '' for what he had done .
magistrate chair , jackie shore , said the dangerous driving offence was `` so severe '' that sentencing would have to happen at northampton crown court , on 10 february .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: nigel levine recovering from crash
text: it 's hoped both nigel levine and james ellington will be visited by team-mates this afternoon , as they continue to recover from their injuries .
ellington shared this video of the two sprinters in action earlier in the camp .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: northamptonshire sprinter hurt in spanish motorbike crash
text: northamptonshire sprinter nigel levine is `` conscious and stable '' after being involved in a motorbike crash in spain with fellow runner , james ellington .
british athletics confirmed the pair were injured yesterday in tenerife , where they were warm-weather training .
it said its staff were with the athletes and were liaising with hospital doctors over treatment .
`` we will not be releasing further information on the severity of their injuries at the present time , '' it said in a statement .
`` both athletes are receiving medical treatment and are conscious and stable . ''
according to reports , the pair were riding on motorbikes when they were involved in a crash with a vehicle travelling in the opposite direction .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: afternoon weather : dry and cloudy
text: the rest of the day will be cloudy and mainly dry with light winds .
there may be a few spots of drizzle over higher ground such as weedon hill .
mild in the north , but feeling colder in the south where some brighter spells are possible .
maximum temperature : 4c ( 39f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: chinese market 'massive opportunity '
text: earlier we mentioned there 's a move to strengthen links between the motorsport and high performance engineering sectors in northamptonshire and china .
an economics lecturer at the university of northampton has been asked by china 's hunan province to help boost trading links with the uk .
one engineering firm in the county says it 's excited about selling services to china .
joey powis , from kwsp based in brackley , said : `` it 's a massive market and important for us in many ways .
`` there are due to be 28 million cars produced out of china this year .
`` there 's a massive opportunity and that 's why we 're looking out there .
it looks pretty promising . ''

documents.title: birchfield springs : residents sick of lorries
text: desborough residents have told us they 're fed up after being plagued by heavy lorries for years .

work started on the £ 2m fishery development at birchfield springs , on rushton road , more than three years ago , but residents on dunkirk avenue say scores of lorries still travel up and down the residential street every day .
mark goff said he once counted 65 lorry movements in one hour and said one woman he knew had ornaments fall off her shelf due to passing traffic .
lyndon thomas ( above ) , the man behind the three fishing lakes , said they have no alternative but to use local roads - and the lakes wo n't be finished for at least another year .

`` i understand there 's a large volume of traffic on occasions , but any construction site , whether it be today or a hundred years ago , would have had a volume of traffic to construct it , '' he said .
`` people need to try and understand there 's no-one who wants this finished sooner than me and my wife . ''
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: new county council hq delayed
text: the new headquarters for northamptonshire county council is to be finished slightly late .
in an email to staff , the authority 's chief executive says one angel square will be fully completed by 6 march .
the process of moving 2,000 staff was due to begin this month , but that will now begin in february .
workers will move from a range of offices around the county to the new multimillion-pound building in northampton town centre .
council meetings will still be held at the existing county hall .
however , there have been concerns over traffic and parking at the new hq .
the email to workers suggests one possible solution , when it says `` exciting news regarding a park and ride [ is ] due to be announced in the coming weeks '' .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: stronger links with china could boost motor trade
text: we all know formula one champions mercedes are based in northamptonshire - building its cars at brackley and its engines at brixworth - but there are many more motorsport companies based locally .
about 1,000 companies are involved in motorsport in the county , employing 21,000 people and contributing £ 2bn to the local economy .
it 's big business , and this morning we 've been hearing stronger links with china could boost the motorsport and high performance engineering sectors even further .

a senior economics lecturer at the university of northampton , dr shaowei he , has been appointed ambassador for international exchange by china 's hunan province , with the aim of strengthening trade links with the uk .
dr he says he wants to encourage `` high level dialogue '' between businesses in northamptonshire and hunan .
author: Willy Gilder
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: weather : cold and sunny
text: today is going to be cold , bright and frosty across most areas to start , but possibly a little cloudier towards the north .
remaining sunny and dry with light winds throughout the day , but it will feel cold when out and about .
maximum temperature : 5c ( 41f ) .
weather has more .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back to live updates from northamptonshire
text: good morning and welcome back to live updates for northamptonshire , where we 'll bring you all the news , weather , sport and travel you need until 18:00 .
there have been some beautiful looking skies this morning but it 's pretty chilly outside - we 'll have the full regional weather forecast with kate kinsella shortly .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: county ins & outs 2017
text: county ins & outs 2017

documents.title: that 's it from us for today
text: live updates for northamptonshire have now finished .
if you want to read more on some of today 's stories then you can find them here :
and we 'll be back tomorrow at 08:00 with all the day 's news , weather , sport and travel .
see you then .

documents.title: weather : cold tonight and tomorrow
text: a largely dry night with clear spells , although thicker cloud will eventually feed down from the north-west .
temperatures could fall as low as -1c ( 30f ) , perhaps even a few degrees lower in some spots , so there will be a frost under clearer skies .
tomorrow will be a largely dry day , although the thickest cloud in the north and west could produce a bit of drizzle .
the best of any brightness and sunshine will be in the south-east of the region .
elsewhere there will generally be more cloud than today .
it 'll remain cold with highs between 3-5c ( 37-41f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: tinsel and garden tools found in recycled christmas trees before they meet 'the beast '
text: have you ever wondered what happens to your christmas tree when you 've finished with it ?
well , i 've been to a company in helmdon , near brackley , which recycles old christmas trees - using this 500-horsepower machine from the usa called a `` beast shredder '' .
ed bastow from the recycling company material change told me that they have magnets to help extract decorations and even rogue garden tools .
he also told me they have to deal with trees still wrapped in tinsel .
he said that the `` majority of what we produce goes to farmland which makes the land more workable '' .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: saracens to sign northampton saints flanker calum clark
text: saracens have agreed a deal to sign flanker calum clark ( left ) from fellow premiership side northampton saints .
the 27-year-old has agreed a three-year contract with sarries and will move to allianz park this summer .
clark made his premiership debut aged 18 for leeds in 2007 and has won one international cap for england , which came against france in august 2015 .
he has played 142 games for the saints , but only made six appearances this season .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: businesses optimistic about exports
text: as the prime minister was setting out her plan for leaving the eu today , i was with businesses looking to grow their exports .
the department for international trade was holding sessions at silverstone park .
in general the firms i spoke to were very optimistic about the prospects of exporting to the eu , even those who voted to remain last year .

the event was n't a representative sample of course , but sam baker from northampton marketing company gavin willis summed up the feeling when she told me : `` anything that can be perceived as a threat can be seen as an opportunity . ''
the prime minister will be hoping for more of that kind of attitude .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: worcester warriors sign northampton saints prop ethan waller for 2017-18
text: worcester warriors have signed northampton saints loose-head prop ethan waller ( right ) for the 2017-18 season .
the 24-year-old kettering-born saints academy product has made 85 appearances since making his debut in november 2012 .
`` ethan has been part of a successful northampton side in recent seasons and has already gained huge experience , '' said warriors head coach carl hogg
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: george north in wales six nations squad
text: northampton saints wing george north is once again a `` wildcard '' for the wales six nations squad .

north , and fellow english-based players jamie roberts and taulupe faletau fall under the so-called `` gatland 's law '' , which limits to three the number of welsh exiles coach rob howley can select this season .
wales start their six nations campaign against italy in rome on sunday , 5 february .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: cobblers sign palace striker anderson
text: cobblers sign palace striker anderson

documents.title: northampton town sign 21-year-old crystal palace striker keshi anderson on loan
text: justin edinburgh has made his first signing as northampton town manager , bringing in crystal palace striker keshi anderson on loanuntil the end of the season .
the 21-year-old has already played 10 times for the cobblers ' league one rivals bolton , on loan , earlier this season .
edinburgh said the striker was `` lively , mobile full of energy '' and that he was `` highly rated '' by palace .
the cobblers make the short trip to mk dons on saturday , where anderson could make his debut for the side .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: afcon 2017 : cobblers defender zakuani satisfied with dr congo victory
text: dr congo captain and northampton defender gabriel zakuani ( right , number 14 ) feels his side have taken hold of africa cup of nations group c after beating morocco .
junior kabananga 's lone goal was enough to give the leopards a winning start as they aim to improve on a third-place finish at the last finals in 2015 .
with ivory coast and togo drawing 0-0 in the group 's other game , dr congo sit top of the table by two points .
`` we saw the other result and we wanted to stamp our authority on the group , '' said zakuani .
`` that was the main thing .
we managed to come through unscathed with three points . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: five facts about the new cobblers boss
text: five facts about the new cobblers boss

documents.title: weather : staying cloudy but mostly dry
text: it 'll be a rather cloudy and cooler day for most .
most places will be dry , but the odd spot of light rain is possible but some brighter spells are also likely , mainly in the south later with a high of 4c ( 39f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: which has better roads , iraq or northampton ?
text: the vice-chancellor of the university of northampton , nick petford , is currently in iraq and it seems he 's slightly more impressed with the road there than many at home
this road in the ancient city of babylon is over 5000 years old and in better nick than many in northampton

documents.title: saracens to sign saints flanker clark
text: saracens to sign saints flanker clark

documents.title: worcester sign northampton 's waller
text: worcester sign northampton 's waller

documents.title: local paper round-up : 'pippa middleton fraud ' arrests , hospital book plea and new home for special school
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire today :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: in sunrise over northamptonshire
text: we 've had wind , rain , snow , and today the sun has come out over northamptonshire .
our bbc weather watchers have been capturing this momentous occasion
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: county cricket club pays back over half of county council loan
text: northamptonshire county cricket club says it 's moved a step closer being debt-free after paying back £ 1m to the county council .
the club owed the council £ 1.9m , after it was lent funds for a new permanent stand at wantage road , but now the outstanding sum has been reduced by more than half .
northampton borough council offered the cricket club a loan facility of a £ 250,000 but that has n't been used .
the club 's chairman gavin warren says it is in a `` great position '' and has `` turned things around '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: eddie jones praises saints forwards wood and harrison
text: england coach eddie jones has said that saints flanker , and captain , tom wood , `` has been the player of the [ premiership ] '' , describing him as `` outstandingly consistent '' .
jones had dropped wood for last year 's six nations , calling him as `` distinctly average '' , but he was recalled for last year 's autumn internationals .
jones also said that fellow saints back row forward teimana harrison `` has been doing well for northampton '' .
harrison made his international debut under jones in the summer tour of australia .
the 24-year-old scored two tries for the saints against castres in the european champions cup on saturday .
author: Chris Jones
BBC Radio 5 live rugby reporter

documents.title: 'like a racehorse that does trials ' - what hartley has to do prove his fitness
text: to prove his fitness , dylan hartley will be put through a training session at northampton , overseen by a member of england 's back room staff , that will simulate a game situation .
`` he 'll do a session that 's the equivalent of a game , '' said england coach eddie jones .
`` a game of test rugby is approximately 36 minutes of ball in play .
you have to run around 120m ( 131yds ) per minute , that 's the average speed .
jones continued : `` it 's old school - run hard , get up , get off the ground , run again .
it will give us a very good indication of where dylan is and his ability to play rugby .
`` it 's like having a racehorse that does trials - if they run fast in the trials there 's a good chance they 're going to run fast in the race . ''
author: Chris Jones
BBC Radio 5 live rugby reporter

documents.title: dylan hartley : eddie jones confident england captain will be fit for the six nations
text: head coach eddie jones says he is confident dylan hartley will be ready to captain england in the six nations .
hartley has not played since 9 december , when he was sent off for striking and received a six-week ban .
but the northampton hooker will have a gruelling series of tests on wednesday to prove his match fitness before the opener against france on 4 february .
`` dylan has been training the house down , and we expect him to be ready to go , '' jones told bbc radio 5 live .
`` he 's got a few hurdles he still has to jump , and if he jumps those and jumps them well , he 'll be captain of the side . ''
hartley is available to play again on 23 january , but is unlikely to feature for northampton in the anglo-welsh cup the following weekend .
author: Chris Jones
BBC Radio 5 live rugby reporter

documents.title: businesses gather to talk exports
text: i 'm at an event in silverstone where businesses are getting advice on increasing their exports .
the workshops are being organised by the department for international trade .
talking about exports seems very appropriate today , as the prime minister sets out more details on her plans for leaving the european union .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: police officer ian caffel sacked over sex advances
text: a police sergeant who made sexual comments or approaches to female colleagues has been sacked for gross misconduct .
northamptonshire police found ian caffel guilty of breaching standards of professional behaviour .
a panel heard he made comments to seven women and had a sexual relationship with a vulnerable colleague between march 2010 and august 2016 .
mr caffel was not present at the hearing , no mitigation was offered and he was dismissed without notice .

the hearing , chaired by chief constable simon edens , was also told mr caffel , who had been with the force for almost seven years , had previously received management advice from bedfordshire police following an investigation into his conduct with younger female colleagues at that force .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: listen : panesar 'missing coronation street and eastenders '
text: monty panesar admits he 's getting a little homesick while out in australia .
the former england bowler is working with the australian spinners and has been asked to advise them on their up coming tour to india .

the spinner , who returned to play for northamptonshire last season , said : `` i got the call to see if i was available to work with some of the players ahead of their tour to india and i was very happy to do that . ''

panesar , 34 , has been down under for over three months now and admits he 's getting more homesick , adding : `` i 'm missing coronation street , eastenders and watching the football - doing the normal english stuff . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: panesar : 'i still want to play for england ' - but northants return unclear
text: monty panesar has said that he still had international ambitions , telling bbc radio 5 live : `` i still want to play for england , i still have that desire . ''
panesar is currently playing grade cricket in australia , and he says that he is `` trying to get my shoulder a lot stronger and get fitter '' .
the 34-year-old returned to northamptonshire , the county were his career started , last season , but it is unclear whether he will play this year .
he told the the tuffers and vaughan cricket show that `` hopefully when i get back i 'll get involved with a county and play first-class cricket '' .
on his role helping the australia side in india , he said coaching was `` something i 've got a passion for '' and revealed he had been helping out his australian side campbelltown 's under-16s .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: spinner monty panesar to help australia before tour of india
text: former england spinner monty panesar is to work with the australia team before their test series in india .
the 34-year-old has been playing grade cricket for sydney side campbelltown , after returning to northamptonshire last summer .
panesar toured india on three occasions and took 17 wickets when england won 2-1 in 2012 , their first series victory there for 27 years .
the left-armer will advise australia 's batsmen and slow bowlers before they depart for the four-test series , which begins on 23 february .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather : dry but cold with sunny periods
text: many places will have increasing amounts of sunshine today but a little cloud is still likely at times .
it will remain dry everywhere with light winds , but also feeling cold .
maximum temperature : 4c ( 39f )
more details from bbc weather :
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back
text: good morning .
we are back with live updates for northamptonshire , with all the news , weather , sport and travel that you need .
unbelievably , given the weather , we are going to be talking cricket and ever wondered where your christmas tree goes when you 've finished with it ?
you 'll find out later .
but first up the full weather forecast .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: australia hire panesar before india tour
text: australia hire panesar before india tour

documents.title: that 's all from us
text: live updates have now finished for northamptonshire .
we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 with all the latest news , weather , sport and travel for the county .
you can read more about valtteri bottas taking the the vacant drivers seat at mercedes on the bbc sport website .
we 'll see you tomorrow .
have a good evening .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bottas says driving for mercedes 'dream come true '
text: in the worst kept secret in formula one , valtteri bottas has officially been announced as the replacement for retired world champion nico rosberg at brackley-based mercedes .
the 27-year-old said : `` it 's definitely another dream come true , to race in another team with such great history - especially in the recent years , which have been so impressive . ''
meanwhile , team boss toto wolff said : `` i think valtteri fits very well in our team .
as a driver he 's very fast and he also has the heart in the right place . ''
no more secrets !
i 'll be driving a silver arrow in 2017 .
so happy and proud to be part of the @ twitterid family !
# f1 # vb77 # mbfamily

documents.title: weather : cold tonight and tomorrow , but with sunshine
text: there 's a very small risk of a shower overnight , but generally it 'll be dry with clear spells and a few fog patches .
with light winds and , under clear skies , lows of about -1c ( 30f ) , there 'll also be a fairly widespread frost .
after a cold and frosty start to tuesday it 'll be a mainly fine and dry day with a good deal of sunshine and brightness .
however , in the north and west there is the potential for cloudier skies .
it 'll continue to feel cold with highs of only 3-5c ( 37-41f ) .
you can find more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: local paper round-up : stabbing in northampton , and europe 's second best elvis
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire today :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'we need smiles on faces ' - edinburgh
text: 'we need smiles on faces ' - edinburgh

documents.title: edinburgh given 'opportunity ' for new players
text: new northampton town manager justin edinburgh said the chairman is giving him the `` opportunity to strengthen the squad and make changes '' .
the 47-year-old already has targets , saying he needs a `` different kind of striker that can stretch defences '' .
edinburgh has already brought in his own staff , with david kerslake coming in as assistant .
kerslake was part of colin calderwood 's backroom staff when he took the cobblers up in 2006 .
edinburgh said the former cardiff assistant `` knows the club very well '' and he spoke to him about the club before taking the job .
author: Caroline Densley
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: new cobblers boss edinburgh has 'optimism and belief '
text: justin edinburgh told me he saw `` spirit '' in northampton town 's 2-1 defeat at home to scunthorpe on saturday and that he `` drove home with optimism and belief '' .

edinburgh said the cobblers `` competed very well against a side that are at the top of the league '' , and that it gave him hope that he can turn around a result that has left the side 16th in league one .
he told me he wants `` a team that plays with a high intensity '' and that side should be looking up rather than down the table .
the former rushden and diamonds boss said he was `` 100 % '' excited and was `` delighted to be given the opportunity '' to manage northampton town .
author: Caroline Densley
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: justin edinburgh : 'i want supporters to look forward ' to coming to sixfields
text: `` i want the supporters to leave games here at sixfields looking forward to coming back '' # ntfc
author: Kris Holland
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: justin edinburgh : 'i was just myself ' to impress cobblers ' chairman
text: justin edinburgh on what he thinks he said to impress in his @ twitterid interview # bbcfootball # bbcsportsday
author: Kris Holland
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: justin edinburgh meets press at sixfields
text: former rushden and diamonds manager justin edinburgh ( left ) is giving his first press conference as northampton town boss .
alongside his assistant david kerslake ( right ) , he said the aim this season is a top-half finish .
he told reporters : `` there 's a good squad here .
i 'm here to try and resolve the reason behind our recent form .
i 'm looking forward to the challenge . ''
author: Caroline Densley
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: in justin edinburgh takes first training session at northampton town
text: new cobblers boss justin edinburgh took his first training session earlier today .
he was joined by new assistant david kerslake at moulton college .
edinburgh 's first press conference is now under way .
we 'll bring you the latest soon .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: valtteri bottas to partner lewis hamilton at mercedes in 2017 season
text: valtteri bottas has succeeded world champion nico rosberg as lewis hamilton 's team-mate at brackley-based mercedes .
the move , expected since december , also sees brazilian felipe massa come out of retirement to replace the 27-year-old finn at williams .
mercedes ' young driver pascal wehrlein , passed over in favour of bottas , joins the swiss sauber team .
massa , 35 , said he was `` extremely motivated to be coming back '' , adding bottas had been given a `` great opportunity '' .
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer

documents.title: holocaust survivor appears on special antiques roadshow episode
text: axel landmann , from northampton , appeared on last night 's holocaust memorial special of antiques roadshow .
fiona bruce and a small team of experts met a remarkable group of british survivors whose lives were shattered by the events of world war two .
this is mr landmann 's story
author: BBC One

documents.title: weather : rain easing , but feeling cold and damp
text: the rain will begin to ease this afternoon , but the skies will stay cloudy and grey and it will be feeling cold , with a high of 5c ( 41f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: county council calls for social care reform
text: northamptonshire county council is calling for `` root and branch reform '' of how the health service and social care work together .
this year it 's estimated the authority will spend £ 145m on adult social care - that 's 34 % of its budget .
the county council says reform is needed to `` ensure the system is financially fit to cope with ever increasing levels of demand '' .
the issue was discussed on sunday politics east yesterday .
you can watch the programme here .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: 'india protocol ' guardians criticise friends abandoning women on nights out
text: volunteers who help lone females in cheltenham 's nightspots , in a scheme named after a murdered northampton woman , have criticised cases of people abandoning their friends .
a group called cheltenham guardians has brought in a policy known as the india protocol , named after india chipchase who was raped and killed after a night out in northampton last year .
a recent incident where a woman was reportedly left abandoned in the spa town was up by several newspapers , including the mirror and daily mail .

posting on facebook , terry howard from the group said : `` sadly we are dealing with more cases where friends are abandoning friends , often leaving them on their own with no money and no way of getting home .
`` our india protocol means we will identify and deal with a good number of lone females , but many will slip through the net .
`` one of these days an abandoned friend may never make it home , only to be found the next day by the police raped and murdered like india chipchase . ''
edward tenniswood is currently serving a life sentence over miss chipchase 's death .

documents.title: man dies in a361 crash
text: a 40-year-old west midlands man has died after a crash on the a361 near ashby st ledgers , northamptonshire , on saturday .
the incident happened at about 10:20 , between kilsby and daventry , when the man 's car collided with a lorry travelling in the opposite direction .
the man from dudley , near birmingham , died at the scene .
northamptonshire police has appealed for witnesses .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: valtteri bottas close to mercedes switch , says williams deputy principal
text: williams ' deputy principal says valtteri bottas is close to leaving the team to replace world champion nico rosberg at brackley-based mercedes .
rosberg retired five days after winning the formula 1 title last year , leaving mercedes without a team-mate for lewis hamilton .
asked if it was a question of `` crossing the t 's and dotting the i 's '' on 27-year-old bottas ' switch , claire williams replied : `` it is exactly that . ''
`` i suppose as soon as nico made his announcement , i knew the call was going to come from toto wolff [ mercedes team boss ] , '' said williams .
`` you do n't want to stand in the way of a driver who has the opportunity to go and race in a car that 's winning races , winning world championships . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: four-goal strikers , derbies & new jobs
text: four-goal strikers , derbies & new jobs
author: Adam Williams
BBC Sport

documents.title: wilson makes first round exit in masters debut
text: kettering 's kyren wilson has made an early exit in his first ever appearance in the uk masters snooker .
the world number 16 was beaten 6-3 by the 2011 winner , ding junhui .
it was always going to a tough task for wilson , with his opponent ranked 10 places above , and as the kettering potter pointed out ahead of the tournament , he was the youngest player .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: justin edinburgh brings in david kerslake as assistant
text: he may have only just taken over , but new northampton town manager justin edinburgh is making changes at sixfields .
david kerslake ( below ) , former nottingham forest , watford and cardiff city coach and assistant manager , joins the club as edinburgh 's number two .
this will be kerslake 's second time coaching at northampton town .
he was assistant manager to colin walderwood and helped the cobblers to promotion in 2006 .
rob page 's backroom staff - assistant paul wilkinson , coach john harbin and goalkeeper coach paddy kenny - have all left the club .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new northampton town manager justin edinburgh set to face the press
text: on friday northampton town appointed former rushden and diamonds manager justin edinburgh as their new boss , following the sacking of rob page a week ago .
edinburgh , who was at sixfields to see his new side lose 2-1 to scunthorpe , officially takes over today .
the 47-year-old , who was sacked by gillingham earlier this month , will face the media this afternoon .
after that he 'll begin preparing for his first game - the short trip on saturday to mk dons .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: monday 's weather : some rain , but brighter further east
text: it 's a chilly morning and there are one or two mist and fog patches around the bbc east region .
there 's also a bit of rain as well , although the further east you are , you 'll see a drier start to the day and there may even be a glimmer of sunshine .
any rain will tend to dry out during the afternoon , and there 'll be a top temperature between 5c and 6c ( 41f - 43f ) .
watch the full regional forecast here :
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to live updates for northamptonshire .
we 'll bring you all the latest news , weather , sport and travel for the county .
later we will hear from the new northampton town manager , justin edinburgh .
but first up the full weather forecast , on what looks like a rainy day .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live
